channel.title: +Agranulocyte on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in +Agranulocyte on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Leucocyte
item.description: T cells Cytotoxic T cells recognize infected cell (by recognizing some antigen) and spur cell death. Memory T cells Reignite during secondary exposure. B cells When activated: Secrete antibodies. Neutralizing antibodies bind to a virus and ensure that they can’t bind to cell receptors. Non-neutralizing antibodies bind to antigens on surface of infected cells - detected by natural killer cells. Plasma cells Some B cells become plasma cells, which secrete antibodies for years.

item.title: Monocyte
item.description: Dendridic cells Major role in adaptive immunity. Antigen-presenting cells (also known as accessory cells). Take infection to lymph nodes and activate T and B cells.
